statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Ill.-Chicago 75, Detroit 67
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Othyus Jeffers scored 20 points and Josh Mayo added 15 Saturday to help Illinois-Chicago snap a seven-game losing streak with a 75-67 victory at Detroit. Brandon Cotton scored 21 points and Ryvon Coville added 20 points and 11 rebounds for the Titans, who lost their third straight. Jeffers had a pair of baskets and two free throws during a late 11-4 run that gave the Flames (10-16, 5-8 Horizon League) the lead for good. Detroit (9-16, 5-8) twice cut the lead to three points in the final minute, but Illinois-Chicago went 7-for-8 from the free-throw line during that stretch to stay in front. The Titans were 5-for-9 from 3-point range in the first half but just 1-for-13 in the second. Robert Bush added 13 points for the Flames, who also got 12 from T.J. Gray and 11 from Jovan Stefanov as they avenged a Jan. 20 loss to Detroit. Titans reserve Jon Goode was 6-for-7 from the field and scored all 16 of his points in the first half to help give Detroit a 30-28 lead at intermission.
